series which makes exciting reading.. **. .Harley, Siegel, and Tyler all commented on
the CBC deale It looks like a good source but evidently a complicated problem....®
Dick Sotterberg of HSUI inquires about the possibility of writing a thesis on
NAEB. If he does as he plans—Dick Rider completes a similar job-^and I get the
information I am after, we really should know something about this Association by
this time next year*
BILOXI AGENDA?* From several things I .have read, it looks like we have gas-pipe
stations as members of HAEB. I hope I have the wrong impression®.•„.Wally Gameau
suggested we investigate thoroughly areas of cooperation and of work of this Office
and Frank Dunham’s office® 7/Jally feels there is considerable duplication.
BROADCASTING BELLOWS: The TV code makes good reading. Someone was really on the
ball when it was written. They evidently had even read our New York study as
evidenced by the section, "Time Standards for Advertising Copy", particularly
Article 6... ..It looks like one of "our" boys is sounding off. How about that?
Incidentally how do we go about keeping everybody on nearly the same course?
IMPORTANT: Mrs. Reed of the Herald-Tribune gave us $600 for tapes. She needs to
be thanked by personal letters from each one of you. Keep it in mind and lo so
at the earliest possible moment.
Jim® ••.o
P.S. Had a call this morning from KcCALL’S for an acetate of the Crane~Goslin-
Weaver section of the H-T Forum. Must be a hot one.
